slides.title: Sprint review Boat, Daf Punk, Prometheus, SheBang and Very Angry Birds

slide.p: This is a combined sprint review for the following teams.

ul.li: Boat
Daf Punk
Prometheus
SheBang
Very Angry Birds

slide.p: The sprint for these teams all started on the 26th of November and ended on the 11th of December 2012. We will go through them one by one;

ul.li: Integrate TTOM for CPP 3.9 release with CPP Map component(2 SP)
Integrate with firehose client for 3.9 release in CSV creator(5 SP)
Setup PControl process for loading 3.9 data(5 SP)
Load the all MDS'es for FATs(2 SP)
TIF2TTOM bug reports(13 SP)
UNCOMMITTED - Separate out TIF2MN and MN2MDS parts of TIF2MDS p-control process template(8 SP)

header.h4: 1233328 Integrate TTOM for CPP 3.9 release with CPP Map component (2 SP)

ul.li: Client is able to serve data in TTOM for CPP 3.9 release - DONE
Cascading edits don't have to work correctly - DONE
There is jenkins job that runs FATs - DONE
Rebase to trunk version
Run FAT's once
Still need to fix deserialization - problems pop up during integration with Shebang

header.h4: 1233346 Integrate with firehose client for 3.9 release in CSV creator (5 SP)

ul.li: CSV Creator is able to get data from firehose in TTOM for CPP 3.9 release - DONE
CSV Creator is able to create CSVs in TTOM for CPP 3.9 release - DONE

header.h4: 1233347 Setup PControl process for loading 3.9 data (3 SP)

ul.li: There is PControl process set up on Iron's L1 for data loading - DONE
It is possible to load any dataset in TTOM for 3.9 release - DONE
Andorra dataset is loaded to MDS - DONE

header.h4: 1233329 Load the all MDS'es for FATs (2 SP)

slide.p: Acceptance criteria:

ul.li: All datasets required for FATs are loaded in TTOM for 3.9 release - DONE
This data is available in "central" MDS in Lodz - DONE

slide.p: Remark

ul.li: There are new datasets added recently to FATs - UC3, OGB, UNJ - they are not yet loaded

slide.div:
Merged stories 1233348, 1233349, 1233350
Found issues (either in coredb stack or in input TTOM haystack data:
Deserialization problems in coredb-main-ws / client - DONE, should be revisited and cleaned
Flipped maneuvers - FIX ready,needs to be verified
Removed step of filtering unnecessary associations
Added ignore handlers in coredb translator component
Fixed constraints and indexes in load scripts - added changes to reduce DB footprint
Added support to all feature types in geometry index field - was missing multipoints and multigeometries (lines + disconnected points)
Still to do:
Finalize integration with Shebang - fix deserialization of some geometry types
Finalize integration with QA
Integrate when we have full content - so far we have 98% of the content in TTOM model

header.h4: 1194393 [3.9 CI] Separate out TIF2MN and MN2MDS parts of TIF2MDS p-control process template (8 SP)

div.p: Cancelled - there was an agreement - conclusions might be found here

ul.li: Toolbox Split and fixing issues(2 SP)
Deployment automation and Continuous Integration L1(5 SP)
Housekeeping

slide.p: Story 1 - Toolbox Split and fixing issues

ul.li: Locality Index NAM
Split, synchronize and fix configs TIF2MN/TIF2TTOM
Validation Criteria - Green builds TIF2MN-Trunk and TIF2TTOM-39

header.h4: Deployment automation and Continuous Integration L1

ul.li: Puppet component deployment
Validation Criteria - Run TIF2TTOM chain via Jenkins
Support L2 / L3 / L4 environments
Rework puppet code for L4 deployment
Support Prometheus for MN 1303 Toolbox
Release latest TIF2TTOM-38R Toolbox
Data load requests
TB 13.03 release
User Story 844697: Enable TB 13.03 so it can work with Yard tagging system
Fix bug wrong parameter used to get country information from YARD
APT sol values bugfix
MN Admin and MN Post product chain dependency bugfix
MN shpa dumper bugfix

slide.p: Scope:

ul.li: YARD usage fixing and validation
APT sol values bugfix
MN Admin and MN Post product chain dependancy bugfix
MN shpa dumper bugfix

slide.p: TB_1303_pb3 toolbox released:

ul.li: Control Plan executed against TB_1212_02 released version
No unexplained differences found between checked builds
Toolbox deployed on production environment in Ghent
Problems with deployment on production environment in India due to IT issues

header.h4: User Story 844697: Enable TB 13.03 so it can work with Yard tagging system

slide.p: Purpose of this story was to perform tests on Toolbox 1303 with YARD tagging system.
Tests were done on:

ul.li: Single dataset country in EUR: AND
Multi dataset country in EUR: CH1 (includes also Lichtenstein as Small Separate Country)
Single dataset state in NAM: UNH
Multi dataset state in NAM: UF1

header.h4: Fix bug wrong parameter used to get country information from YARD

slide.p: To get country related information (ISO country code, ISO country number...) the YARD webservice is used. Our request contained:

code.pre: "scopetype": "Country", "scopeexternalid": <iso code from TIF>, "referencetype": "Country has ISO Country Code"

slide.p: Instead of scopeexternalid parameter we should use scopeadminkey.
Side of line for APTs connected with edge having opposite directionality versus Road Element was wrongly converted.

header.h4: MN Admin and MN Post product chain dependency bugfix

slide.p: The story was about restoring relation between two steps:

ul.li: Convert MN postal
Create indices on Admin Boundary tables (2)

slide.p: Due to lack of dependency, records were missing in the PLIA table.
The solution has been tested and now Convert MN postal can start only after Create indices on Admin Boundary tables (2).
This story was about Oracle errors silently being ignored during the conversion of MultiNet Shape Admin, in case of Oracle connection/instability problems.
Now, we will throw a DBError and stop the conversion if problems occur.
Proper unittests were added to check the new functionality.

ul.li: Release haystack-server, check-out enabled(3 SP)
Enable ALL TTOM content(3 SP)
Check-out enabled, means loading data from M(aster)D(ata)S(tore)
Code is adapted, but during validation, issue in coredb-main-client was found
This issue is being handled by boat team, but needs re-validation
Release can only be done when it works

slide.p: What is ALL content?

ul.li: Must be modeled in TTOM 3.8
Must be converted by TIF2TTOM

slide.p: This means: all TIF content that's also available in MN product: Core + POI + Apt + Ada
Validated on Hakuna Matata, as that should contain all types of features
All differences are explainable: not (yet) modeled in TTOM
Also extended shapewriter demo project with Level2Roads and Intersections

ul.li: Multinet-R: Housekeeping(2 SP)
Multinet-R: Hierarchical indexing(2 SP)
Multinet-R: Generate semi-enhanced routing layer(3 SP)
Multinet-R: Validation Pilot(2 SP)

p.span: Christophe, Dominique, Elke, Peter, Pieter, Rebekka

slide.p: Because of developments in previous sprint, existing MNR prototype code could be improved:

ul.li: use of admin cache to fill up left/right admin references in geolink
generic code to fill up MNR name model; this can however not (yet) be used in a lot of places because most names in the current TTOM model are not yet build according to the 'new name model'

slide.p: New memory optimized Admin/index CacheBuilder has been designed:

ul.li: strictly required attributes: id, name, official code
hierarchy (parent-child links)

slide.p: Relying on this hierarchy, MNR_Hierarchical_Index is partly populated:

ul.li: OK: Admin areas (from country up to order 9)
OK: Index areas (order 1 to 10)
OK: Built up areas
Not yet OK: admin places, postal districts

slide.p: Still missing in MNR (because not all required data available in TTOM)

ul.li: Some attributes (like 2 and 3 digit ISO country codes)
Links to localities (as we know them from the locality index)

slide.p: Next steps:

ul.li: Fully integrate index areas into hierarchy
Names for hierarchical index: not done because TTOM is missing correct name model implementation
Link from route network to hierarchical index
Low Emission (Restrictions)
Toll Road (Restrictions)
Speed Restrictions (Restrictions)
Road Furniture
Maneuvers
Timedomains

slide.p: We will be delivering data at the end of the coming sprint, and needed validation capabilities to make sure we have at least some level of quality control on the output
We are not writing to a database output, so we can't do the usual query based approach. Therefore we created a mini java based way of reading an querying the data.
The validation tests:

ul.li: Run every time code is changed on the pilot
Check against Hakuna Matata data
Use the MNR physical model for names of tables and or fields
Break (stop compiling) if a change in the model causes the validation tests to become invalid.
